tuning_strategy.selection_rationale: In this non-IID client drift setting, the one-sided projector Π_t (controlled by subspace_ratio r/d) dictates how much of the gradient is retained; the stepsize lr interacts with projected momentum and affects stability; the number of local steps tau (local_steps) determines the magnitude of client drift before aggregation. Tuning these three is most impactful for convergence behavior under heterogeneity.

configs.rationale: Smaller subspace with slightly reduced lr and fewer local steps to curb drift while leveraging projection benefits.
Moderate subspace size with conservative lr at default tau to balance learning speed and stability.
Default r/d with lower lr and shorter local blocks to reduce client drift yet keep adequate update magnitude.
Very small subspace to strongly filter drift, compensated by default lr and fewer steps to avoid underfitting.
Larger subspace approaching full space; reduce lr and allow slightly longer local blocks to test stability vs speed.
Intermediate r/d with modest lr and reduced tau to probe faster convergence without excessive drift.
Aggressive lr with very short local blocks and small subspace to test if quick updates can still be stable under projection.
Larger r/d with conservative lr and longer local blocks to explore projection’s ability to stabilize extended local training.

tuning_strategy.expected_improvement: We expect SFedAvg to achieve faster and more stable loss reduction and to close the accuracy gap under strong heterogeneity when subspace_ratio is tuned to a moderate range (≈0.10–0.20), lr is reduced (≈0.10–0.15), and local_steps are shortened (≈2–4), thereby mitigating drift while preserving effective learning.

- Key distinction: Strong client drift from skew; contrasts FedAvg's plain local SGD with SFedAvg's one-sided projected momentum under C=0.2 and subspace_ratio=0.1.

Tuning Analysis - non-iid_label_skew_(client_drift_stress_test)
1) Best Configuration: subspace_ratio=0.30, lr=0.12, local_steps=8 (config_8) achieved the highest SFedAvg test accuracy (final 0.9722) and the lowest train loss (final 0.1212), outperforming all other tested settings.
2) Performance Improvement: Compared to baseline SFedAvg (final test acc 0.9389), config_8 improves accuracy by ~3.6% relative and reduces final train loss by ~67.8%, indicating substantially faster and more stable convergence under heterogeneity.
3) Parameter Insights: subspace_ratio had the strongest impact—moderate-to-high r/d (0.25–0.35) consistently improved SFedAvg; lr needed to be conservative (≈0.10–0.12) to avoid instability with projected momentum; longer local_steps (≈8) helped SFedAvg due to momentum projection mitigating client drift, while very small r (0.05) or aggressive lr (0.25) degraded performance.
4) Recommendation: Use subspace_ratio=0.30, lr=0.12, local_steps=8 with momentum=0.9 and client_frac aligned to the scenario (e.g., 0.2); this setting balances projection strength and step size, yielding superior accuracy and markedly lower training loss under strong label skew.
